intro: Cassinia petrapendula, commonly known as the rock cassinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its small, yellowish flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cassinia petrapendula is adapted to withstand drought and is often used in native gardens for its hardy nature and ornamental value.
